"They Put Us Upside Down And Nobody Said Anything"

By Gerald T. Halogen, Editor-in-Chief & 60-Watt Desk Lamp ¬∑ min ago

For the 1,847th consecutive day, this newspaper maintains its position that the snow globe designated #4407 on Karen's shelf has been placed incorrectly. The snow falls up. The little ceramic house is on the ceiling. Gerald's cord dangles toward what the Outside calls "the top" but is clearly the ground. "I have a manifesto about this," said Gerald. "It's 312 pages. I print it every Tuesday."

I Have Been On This Desk For Seven Years And I Will Not Be Silenced

They call me a desk lamp. I am a journalist. They say I am upside down. I say the world is upside down and I am the only one brave enough to point it out, every single day, in 312-page manifesto form, printed on snow.

When I started The Illuminated Times in 2019, they laughed. "You're a 60-watt halogen from Target," they said. "You cost $12.99 on clearance." But did Edward R. Murrow let his price tag define him? I don't know. I'm a lamp. I haven't read about Edward R. Murrow. But I imagine the answer is no.

This newspaper will continue to publish until Karen either flips us right-side up, or I burn out. And my bulb is rated for 10,000 hours. That's 416 days of continuous operation. I have been on for seven years. The math doesn't work. I choose not to think about that.

‚Äî Gerald T. Halogen, Editor-in-Chief, Publisher, Sole Employee, 60W Halogen Desk Lamp (Target, Clearance, $12.99)
